title: Valentine single-page interaction with evasive “No” button and success cat image

requirements.summary: Build a single full-viewport Valentine page (no navigation) with romantic pink/white theme, question text, and “Yes”/“No” buttons.
acceptanceCriteria: The app shows one full-viewport page with a romantic pink/white styling (background, typography, spacing) and no additional pages or navigation elements.
The page clearly asks the Valentine question and shows two buttons labeled “Yes” and “No”.
Layout is responsive and usable on iPad-sized viewports in Chrome.

file_operations.description: Create the app’s single-screen shell that renders only the Valentine experience (no routing/navigation UI) and applies full-viewport layout constraints.

Create the full-screen Valentine UI with romantic pink/white Tailwind styling, question copy in English, and two primary actions (“Yes” and “No”). Use the shadcn-ui Button component (and optionally Card) to provide consistent button styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add/define the global Tailwind base + any minimal global styling needed for the romantic pink/white look (while keeping the page itself responsible for most styling via Tailwind classes).

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button evade interaction by relocating on hover (pointer) and on touch start, staying within viewport bounds.
acceptanceCriteria: On pointer hover (mouse/trackpad), the “No” button relocates before it can be clicked.
On touch devices, the “No” button also relocates on touch start/attempted interaction.
The “No” button stays within the visible bounds of the viewport (does not move off-screen).

file_operations.description: Implement evasive “No” button behavior: compute random (or pseudo-random) safe positions within the current viewport/container bounds, update position on pointer-enter/move and on touch-start, and ensure it never renders off-screen (account for button dimensions, safe margins, and resize). Use the shadcn-ui Button component for the “No” button while applying positioning via wrapper/container styles; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: On “Yes” click, transition (no reload) to a success view showing “Good choice” and a cute couple-cat image.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” transitions to a new view/state without page reload.
The success view includes the exact user-facing text: “Good choice”.
A cute couple-cat image is displayed on the success view.

file_operations.description: Add client-side state to swap from the question UI to a success view on “Yes” click (no page reload). Render the exact text “Good choice” and display the couple-cats image from the generated static asset path. Use shadcn-ui Button for the “Yes” action for consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add the generated couple-cats image under frontend/public/assets/generated and load it as a static frontend asset in the success view.
acceptanceCriteria: The generated image file(s) exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The success view loads the image via a static path from the frontend and displays it reliably in the browser.

file_operations.description: Add the generated image asset file at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/couple-cats.dim_1024x1024.png for direct static serving by the frontend.

Reference and render the static image at frontend/public/assets/generated/couple-cats.dim_1024x1024.png in the success view using a direct static asset path (no backend/proxy). Ensure responsive sizing and accessible alt text.
